body: Finally, some reasonable attempts to address the impact of overcrowding on the locale.
summary: Efforts are being made to address the impact of overcrowding in certain areas.

body:
You think having people pay will less the overcrowding?

It's just to fill the pockets of certain people. The trash will not be cleaned up, the money will not be spent on what it is collected for.
summary: There is skepticism regarding the effectiveness of fees in reducing overcrowding, with concerns that the collected money may not be used for intended purposes.

body:
Well, it would reduce the type of traveller who finds it expensive. You’d be surprised how many slum it and dirty various places.

I don’t claim that it would be a perfect solution and definitely not
summary: It is suggested that imposing fees might reduce the number of travelers who contribute to overcrowding, although it's not a perfect solution.

body: Maybe I'm misreading these, but I'm seeing like...17 travel days in a 22 day stretch. And 20 different cities? It's a lot. You're going to end up crossing a lot of cities and sites off your checklist,
summary: An itinerary including 17 travel days and 20 cities in 22 days is considered excessive, likely requiring significant travel time and adjustments.

body: I hope you like trains, because it seems as if you're going to be spending a quarter of your waking hours on them.
summary: Travelers should be prepared for extensive train travel if following a busy itinerary.

body: If you want then you on day 9 you can walk from Honshu to Kyushu via undersea tunnel
summary: Travelers can walk from Honshu to Kyushu via an undersea tunnel, providing a unique travel experience.

body:
I have nothing of value to say but want to praise how beautifully you formated this post.


In a sub where 90% of people put 0 effort into making their itineraries readable for others, this is a gem.
summary: The comment praises the formatting of a post.

body:
Thanks! I guess you're not misreading—it really is 20 locations in 3 weeks. \^\^'

The first exclusion I'd consider is dropping Shimonoseki and spending more time in Kagoshima. Another option would be
summary: Suggestions for itinerary adjustment include dropping Shimonoseki in favor of more time in Kagoshima.

body: Hard pill to swallow but I came for this type of comments! Thanks!
summary: The comment expresses appreciation for travel advice received.

body: TIL thanks! It's kinda hilarious tough:D
summary: The comment makes a humorous remark.

>What would you drop from the schedule to make it m
summary: Discussion on how travel plans might be affected by the timing of the trip, specifically if it's at the end of March.

body: Way too busy, especially the Kansai part. Have you tried pinning down the locations and checking out how much time it takes to travel between locations? And on top of the already way-to-packed itinera
summary: Feedback on an itinerary suggests it is too busy, especially in the Kansai region, and recommends evaluating travel times between locations.

body: 1) USJ should be a full day in my opinion. Some people will do 1/2 day to only do SNW. I personally wouldnt but if persons love Mario that much to spend that money to do 1/2 day then props to them. I'
summary: Universal Studios Japan (USJ) is recommended as a full-day activity, especially for fans of Super Nintendo World (SNW).

body: Kinkakuji does not open early morning.  Only from 9 am, which I don’t consider early morning for Kyoto……
summary: Kinkakuji temple in Kyoto opens at 9 am, which is not considered early morning.

body:
>Way too busy, especially the Kansai part

The Kanto part is also way too overpacked, with the same basic issue (going back and forth around the city without grouping locations). A good third could be
summary: Feedback on an itinerary suggests it is overpacked, especially in the Kanto region, with recommendations to optimize location visits.

summary: Discussion on itinerary planning, emphasizing the rough concept and the need to pay attention to logistics.

body:

So my question is, is it
summary: Inquiry about whether visiting a theme park is worthwhile for a movie fan who has never been to one.

body: Thank you for the information, I will just replace things within the day! This is more of a general concept than a fully detailed, must do list.
summary: Comment on making adjustments within a day's itinerary, describing it as a general concept rather than a detailed plan.
